es.csic.iiia.nsm.net.norm

Class NormativeNetwork

  • java.lang.Object
    • es.csic.iiia.nsm.net.norm.NormSynthesisNetwork<T>
      • es.csic.iiia.nsm.net.norm.GeneralisationNetwork<Norm>
        • es.csic.iiia.nsm.net.norm.NormativeNetwork

  • public class NormativeNetwork
extends GeneralisationNetwork<Norm>
    A normative network is a directed graph whose nodes stand for norms and whose edges stand for relationships between norms. Additionally, the normative network contains the following information about the norms it contains:
    1. the state (whether active or inactive) of each norm in the normative network;
    2. the utility of each norm, which contains information about how the norm performs to avoid conflicts with respect to the system norm evaluation dimensions and goals; and
    3. the generalisation level of each norm in the network, which stands for the height of the norm in the generalisation graph
    Author:
    "Javier Morales (jmorales@iiia.csic.es)"
    See Also:
    Norm, Utility
